item.title: The number one piece of advice for passwords from @1Password‚Äôs VP of Engineering is to not reuse them. Using a different password for every service you sign up to will keep you more secure online. Learn more when you listen to Episode 5 of #DigitalCitizen. https://www.fastmail.com/digitalcitizen/how-to-stay-safe-online-with-michael-fey/
item.dc:creator: @Fastmail
item.description:

item.title: R to @tomslominski: Hi Tom! At this time, we don't offer custom presets for snooze. If you raise a ticket with our support team, they'll be happy to file this as a feature request for you! http://fastmail.com/support
item.dc:creator: @Fastmail
item.description: Hi Tom! At this time, we don't offer custom presets for snooze. If you raise a ticket with our support team, they'll be happy to file this as a feature request for you! fastmail.com/support

item.title: RT by @Fastmail: I use @Fastmail #FMScheduledSend feature to write up emails on weekends but have them send on Monday mornings so they don‚Äôt have to feel like responding back on weekends.
item.dc:creator: @doronkatz

item.title: Thank you to everyone who told us how they plan to use #FMScheduledSend. It was a huge joy to read through all of your responses, which have inspired many to be better digital citizens. Congratulations to our winner @schmutzie!

item.title: R to @PTRSchuh: Hi Peter! No widespread issues that we're aware of. We see your tickets, and we can assure you our support team is looking into this for you. We'll update you in the ticket as soon as we have details to share with you.
item.dc:creator: @Fastmail
item.description: Hi Peter! No widespread issues that we're aware of. We see your tickets, and we can assure you our support team is looking into this for you. We'll update you in the ticket as soon as we have details to share with you.

item.title:
R to @Fastmail: All Fastmail users can add individual event colors to calendar events to help them stand out on their busy schedules.
Try it now!
http://www.fastmail.com/calendar
item.dc:creator: @Fastmail
item.description:
All Fastmail users can add individual event colors to calendar events to help them stand out on their busy schedules.

Try it now!

fastmail.com/calendar

item.title: R to @Fastmail: ‚ÄúPeople‚Äôs days are so busy, and color is a great way to make important events stand out.‚Äù - @hhorstall
item.dc:creator: @Fastmail
item.description: ‚ÄúPeople‚Äôs days are so busy, and color is a great way to make important events stand out.‚Äù - @hhorstall

item.title:
R to @Fastmail: Do you have a haircut, a child's recital, or a job interview coming up?
At Fastmail, we understand how essential it is to maintain a good work-life balance.
So, with individual event colors, you can easily identify unique events in your calendar at a glance.
item.dc:creator: @Fastmail
item.description:
Do you have a haircut, a child's recital, or a job interview coming up?

At Fastmail, we understand how essential it is to maintain a good work-life balance.

So, with individual event colors, you can easily identify unique events in your calendar at a glance.

item.title:
Calendar Personalization is here!
Now, you can color-code your calendar to bring focus to important events.
üßµRead on to learn more
item.dc:creator: @Fastmail
item.description:

item.title: R to @bonny_ken: Hi Ken! The red shields you see here are spam scores. The higher the number, the more likely it is that the message is spam. If you have any questions or issues regarding spam scores, please file a ticket with our support team! http://fastmail.com/support
item.dc:creator: @Fastmail
item.description: Hi Ken! The red shields you see here are spam scores. The higher the number, the more likely it is that the message is spam. If you have any questions or issues regarding spam scores, please file a ticket with our support team! fastmail.com/support

item.title: R to @Optimus_on_66: Hello Jimmy, our procedures for whether ‚Äî and when ‚Äî an address can be recycled are under review. We have updated the request with your concerns so that your feedback can be part of that review process.
item.dc:creator: @Fastmail
item.description: Hello Jimmy, our procedures for whether ‚Äî and when ‚Äî an address can be recycled are under review. We have updated the request with your concerns so that your feedback can be part of that review process.

item.title: R to @Optimus_on_66: Hi Jimmy, we can understand your concern. However, you‚Äôll be glad to know that the incident this post refers to was in 2017 and we have greatly strengthened (and continue to review) our procedures and security protocols in the years since then.
item.dc:creator: @Fastmail
item.description: Hi Jimmy, we can understand your concern. However, you‚Äôll be glad to know that the incident this post refers to was in 2017 and we have greatly strengthened (and continue to review) our procedures and security protocols in the years since then.
